decks.notes: This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. The key strategy involves playing efficient creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast, while using cards like Embercleave and Shatterskull Smashing to push through damage and take control of the battlefield. The deck also includes some utility cards like Scavenging Ooze and Thrashing Brontodon to deal with opposing threats. By applying constant pressure and maximizing combat synergies, this deck aims to close out games quickly and decisively.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly flood the board with powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggression. By generating mana efficiently and utilizing cards like Feasting Troll King, Lovestruck Beast, and Wicked Wolf, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while maintaining card advantage through cards like Trail of Crumbs and The Great Henge. With a strong focus on mono green creatures and support cards, this deck aims to outpace and outmuscle the opponent in the early to mid game.

This deck focuses on utilizing the aggressive creatures and spells in the Rakdos color combination to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage as efficiently as possible. The deck includes powerful creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, and Woe Strider, as well as removal spells and card draw effects to maintain pressure on the opponent. By combining strong creatures with impactful spells, this deck aims to set the pace of the game and force the opponent to react to its aggressive threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells, board wipes, and disruptive enchantments. The main win condition is to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage with cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Mazemind Tome. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Doom Foretold and Elspeth Conquers Death, while setting up a strong late game presence with cards like Archon of Sun's Grace and Emeria's Call. The deck is built to control the board and grind out incremental advantages until the opponent is overwhelmed.

The key concept of this Gruul Aggro deck is to establish a fast and aggressive board presence with efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Brushfire Elemental. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early creature aggression, backed up by powerful combat tricks like Embercleave. The inclusion of card draw engines like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge helps maintain card advantage, while cards like Shatterskull Smashing provide additional removal options. Overall, the deck focuses on early pressure and maximizing damage output to quickly close out games.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to use a combination of counterspells, removal, and graveyard manipulation to control the game while gradually milling the opponent's deck. By utilizing cards like Into the Story, Drown in the Loch, and Lullmage's Domination, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and win conditions. Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Ruin Crab provide additional mill support, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den acts as a versatile companion that can bring back key cards from the graveyard. With a focus on control and mill, this deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play creatures like Brazen Borrower, Soaring Thought-Thief, Thieves' Guild Enforcer, and Zareth San, the Trickster to deal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Drown in the Loch, Heartless Act, and Didn't Say Please to control the opponent's board while drawing cards with Into the Story. The mana base allows for consistent access to both blue and black mana sources to cast the spells in the deck efficiently.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a strong board presence using efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, while using powerful combat tricks such as Embercleave to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like The Great Henge to provide card advantage and additional power to its creatures. With a mix of aggressive and resilient threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game and maintain pressure until victory.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Lovestruck Beast, supported by efficient removal spells and powerful equipments like Embercleave. The deck aims to apply pressure early on, disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage through cards like Edgewall Innkeeper. The deck also utilizes ramp cards like Kazandu Mammoth and The Great Henge to ensure a consistent stream of threats and resources to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game swiftly.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by controlling the board with cards like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act, while also milling their library with cards like Ruin Crab and Merfolk Windrobber. By utilizing the graveyard and leveraging the power of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, this deck aims to out-value the opponent through attrition and card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Soaring Thought-Thief and Thieves' Guild Enforcer also help to increase the pressure on the opponent and make it difficult for them to recover.

The deck focuses on using powerful red control cards to dominate the game. With a mix of removal spells, board wipes, and card draw, it aims to out-value and outlast its opponent. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon acts as a finisher while Bonecrusher Giant and Ox of Agonas provide early board presence. The deck also includes ramp options with Solemn Simulacrum and Irencrag Feat to quickly access its high mana cost spells. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and win through attrition and powerful late-game threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing opponents through powerful enchantments and removal spells. By utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, players are able to consistently blink their permanents for value. The deck also includes a mix of sweepers like Extinction Event and Shatter the Sky, as well as powerful enchantments like Doom Foretold and Elspeth Conquers Death to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the strategy revolves around generating card advantage and keeping the opponent's threats in check until the player can secure a win condition.

This deck focuses on using a variety of control spells and creatures to manipulate the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It relies on countering spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage through cards like Ashiok, Nightmare Muse and Shark Typhoon. The goal is to control the game by consistently answering threats while setting up win conditions like Crawling Barrens and Shark Typhoon. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent while maintaining a strong defensive position throughout the game.

The main focus of this Esper Control deck is to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of removal spells, enchantments, and powerful creatures. The deck aims to stall the game until it can establish a dominating board presence with cards like Dream Trawler and Archon of Sun's Grace. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value and card advantage. With a mix of disruption, card advantage, and powerful finishers, this deck seeks to outlast the opponent and win through attrition.

The deck focuses on quickly playing small creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal. By combining aggressive creatures like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Brazen Borrower with disruptive spells like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while dealing damage and setting up powerful late-game plays. The inclusion of Zareth San, the Trickster and Soaring Thought-Thief adds even more pressure to the opponent, forcing them to deal with threats from multiple angles and potentially overwhelming them with card advantage.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by disrupting your opponent's strategy while using cards that provide card advantage and versatility. By utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes, you can maintain control of the board and prevent your opponent from developing their game plan. Additionally, cards like Ashiok, Nightmare Muse and Shark Typhoon allow for additional threats to be generated while maintaining control over the game. This Dimir Control deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through careful resource management and efficient use of powerful control tools.
